Peppa Task Manager is a desktop application for managing your tasks through a Graphical User Interface (GUI). It supports three types of tasks: todos, deadlines, and events, with flexible date-time formatting and intelligent task sorting.
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for your task manager.
4. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in, and use the `java -jar peppa.jar` command to run the application.
5. Type your commands in the text box and press Enter to execute them.
6. Refer to the Features below for details of each command.
Adds a simple task without any date/time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a task that needs to be done before a specific date/time.
When time is not specified, it defaults to 23:59 (end of day).
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a task that spans over a period of time.
- Start time defaults to 00:00 (start of day)
- End time defaults to 23:59 (end of day)
Got it. I've added this task:
[E][ ] project meeting (from: Dec 2 2019 2 PM to: Dec 2 2019 4 PM)
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Shows all tasks in your task list, automatically sorted by priority.
Here are the tasks in your list:
2.[E][ ] project meeting (from: Dec 2 2019 2 PM to: Dec 2 2019 4 PM)
1. Tasks with deadlines/times appear first, sorted by date/time (earliest first)
2. Tasks without deadlines/times (todos) appear last, sorted alphabetically
Marks the specified task as completed.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
[E][X] project meeting (from: Dec 2 2019 2 PM to: Dec 2 2019 4 PM)
Marks the specified task as not completed.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
[E][ ] project meeting (from: Dec 2 2019 2 PM to: Dec 2 2019 4 PM)
Removes the specified task from your task list.
Now you have 2 in the list
Finds tasks whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Peppa automatically saves your tasks to `./data/Peppa.txt` after each command. The data is loaded automatically when you start the application.
- Invalid date formats will show an error message
- Invalid task indices will show appropriate error messages
- Corrupted data files will be handled gracefully
| Add Deadline | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by DATE_TIME` | `deadline return book /by 2/12/2019 1800` |
| Add Event | `event DESCRIPTION /from START /to END` | `event meeting /from 2/12/2019 1400 /to 2/12/2019 1600` |
* Parses a raw user command and triggers the matching TaskList / Storage / Ui action.
* Creates a parser bound to the given collaborators.

* @param storage  persistence layer used for serialising {@code tasks}
* @param ui       user-interface helper for printing separators / prompts
assert tasks != null : "TaskList should not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage should not be null";

assert !input.isEmpty() : "Input command should not be empty after trimming";

assert parts.length > 1 : "Find command should have a search argument";

* Persists the user’s tasks: saves the current list to disk and recreates it on start-up.

* Builds a Storage backed by the given path and guarantees that
* the file (and its parent directory) exist, loading any data found.
* @param file location of the save file relative to the project root
public Storage(String filePath) { //creating a new instance of Save will try to create a saveFile
assert filePath != null && !filePath.isEmpty() : "File path should not be null or empty";
assert this.file.isFile() : "file should be a file if it exists";

assert createdFile : "Save file should be created successfully";
* Serialises every task in {@code tasks} to the backing file,
* @return {@code true} on success, {@code false} if any I/O error occurs
assert tasks != null : "TaskList to save should not be null";
assert tl != null : "Task list should not be null";
assert deleted : "Existing file should be deleted successfully";

assert saveFileDesc != null : "Save file description should not be null";
* Reads the backing file, reconstructs all tasks it contains and
* returns them as a list; returns {@code null} if the file is missing
* @return list of tasks recovered from disk, or {@code null} on failure
* @throws IOException if a low-level I/O error prevents reading the file
assert file != null : "File path should not be null";
assert line != null : "Line read from file should not be null";
assert splitLine.length >= 3 : "Save file line should have at least 3 fields";
assert splitLine.length >= 5 : "Event should have at least 5 fields";
assert splitLine.length >= 4 : "Deadline should have at least 4 fields";

* @param description free-text details of the event

*             With time: d/M/yyyy HHmm, dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm, yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm, etc.
*             Date only: d/M/yyyy, dd/MM/yyyy, yyyy-MM-dd, etc.
*             If time is not specified, defaults to 00:00 (start of day)
* @param to   end date-time in the same format
*             If time is not specified, defaults to 23:59 (end of day)
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
this.from = parseDateTime(from.trim(), true);  // true = start time (00:00 default)
this.to = parseDateTime(to.trim(), false);     // false = end time (23:59 default)
